newsitem.title: USA: NCR says it is a leading Windows NT vendor.
newsitem.headline: NCR says it is a leading Windows NT vendor.

text.p: NCR Corp said on Monday that a study showed NCR is a leading vendor of large computer systems using Microsoft Corp's Windows NT operating system.
AT&T Corp plans to spin off its NCR unit by the year-end.

"Our research indicates NCR is the leader in shipments of large NT systems (those costing more than $50,000)," Steve Josselyn of International Data Corp, an independent computer industry analyst firm, said in an NCR statement.
The study said that, based on shipment revenues of U.S.-based computer vendors, NCR has 65.8 percent of world market share of large NT-based systems, NCR said.
Last year it had 11.2 percent, or second largest market share, it said.

Separately, NCR said it has improved availability levels for NCR systems using PeopleSoft Inc's Human Resource Management software and Informix Corp's database management system. A spokesman said the enhanced availability will enable more users to use such a system at the same time and reduce down time.
